website_summaries.verdict: This reasonably-priced edger is suitable for small to mid-level jobs, and easy for most consumers to use. Owners like that the blade is both U-shaped and serrated.
pros: Features an arched blade that makes it possible to cut curved or straight lines around
Serrated edge is built for working in hard soil
cons: Some types of thick, tough grass challenge it
A few users question its longevity with heavy-duty use

customer_reviews.title: I'll keep it simple.... BUY THIS ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it simple.... BUY THIS ONE👍🤘. I'm 240lbs and this thing did the job no problem; the build quality is solid. Check out the before and after pics👉
customer_reviews.author: Darth Bearz

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool created a lot of work for me!! Bought to edge grass off of sidewalks that had not been properly edged for several years. I am a senior woman of medium strength and build and had to put a little effort into the project and stretch out over several days but it was so well worth it. Edging came out beautifully and I am getting lots of positive comments about it! Item is fairly easy to use and sturdy. The reason I say it cost me a lot of work is because I keep finding new places to use it. Great product and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheynannigans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Worked great for my restoration project. Its sharp spiky edge cuts right through thick grass straight and precise. Very sturdy and solid, but not too heavy. Got the job done. Happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome time saver
customer_reviews.text: Used this to install garden edging and it allowed me to make straight and curved lines that look professionally done. They suggest you dig 5' into the ground for the edging to stay secure and the mower to run over top of it. This edger digs 5-6" deep on the first try. Wish I'd bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: cucmesmile

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Cost Effective! Bring Elbow Grease
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my trimmer didn't edge well and I was too cheap to buy an electric edger. This thing works. It has teeth around the bottom and cuts well into dirt and weeds. Cuts most away with first press into the ground. Obviously it takes more effort and time, but at least I know it will work as long as my body does. Would definitely recommend for smaller yards. I wouldn't get it if your yard has more than 100 or so feet worth of edging.
customer_reviews.author: SilentStorm

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I have been abusing this thing ever since I got it and it's holding up like a champ! My neighbors have become inspired and want to start edging their lawns too. I wish i got this sooner, it really makes a big impact to the look of my yard!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not really great for short people
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would be able to use this myself to trim the sidewalk edges. Unfortunately, the handle is too tall for someone who is only 5 feet tall. I can't get the leverage to push it down into the ground. My husband, who is 6 foot 2 inches had no trouble with it at all. He has enough height to get leverage to push it down. It does do a nice job of edging, but if I want to do it, I'll have to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Elbie

customer_reviews.title: Love this simple tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! I’m a 40 year old woman that hates yard work. This tool was so easy to use, and made edging my flower bed simple. For soil that was hard to push through, I just soaked the section with the garden hose and it was manageable. I definitely recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shaw

customer_reviews.title: My straight spade works better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would make edging easier. I normally use a straight edged spade, but had trouble getting consistent depth. This edger has a horizontal piece supposedly to keep depth consistent and to put your foot on, but it is not big enough. The blade only gets to the proper depth in the middle, which means you have to push it in about every 2 inches - takes forever to edge a bed. It is sturdy and seems good quality, but just doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: jamendan

customer_reviews.title: Works good if your soil is soft.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from Amazon and the price was less than regular retail for a quality tool. I was using it to bury 20 gauge wire around my yard for a dog containment system. I needed to go down about 4 to 6 inches. Unfortunately, I live in South Carolina. The soil is made up of red clay which is extremely hard to dig into to. The tool did work pretty well around lawn areas but once I got outside this area I literally tried to push the tool in with my feet and then pound it in with a hammer. But it did stand up to the pounding and never bent.
customer_reviews.author: PLJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this product. I've edged my entire yard with it and it really works well. Very sturdy and simple to use. It does right through the lawn. Every now and then I hit a rock or root and it doesn't go through, but I just change angles or sift a bit and keep going. I recommend and would buy this again.

customer_reviews.title: Good Edging Tool

customer_reviews.title: makes cutting an edge or border a piece of cake...

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for edging driveway or sidewalk

So if you just use it as an edgier and not a shovel, you will be fine. (shovel in the picture was to load chunks into yard waste bin. And I thought I had better after pics but I don’t and it’s raining right now) Apparently the pictures didn't rotate like I thought they would...

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, can take heavy use

The sawtooth edges help trim through the longer blades if grass before cutting into the soil. I have TONS of sidewalk in my yard and some flower beds that meet directly with grass. My whole yard looks so neat now! Great workout, too.

This edger is sharp and made short work of years of overgrowth along both sides of our driveway, cutting through packed dirt, tough grass, and roots. Now I will begin to edge the sidewalk that runs along the highway at the front of our property. I highly recommend this AMES Saw-Tooth Border Edger with T-Grip. Great product!

I tried to twist it back, which took a whole lot more force than I had been applying to it. Got it twisted back but after awhile, the twist would return. So I just have to use it with my hands not quite the same distance from my body, just focusing on getting the blade straight. It's not twisted much but I'm subtracting a star.

customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use, even for an inexperienced gardener like myself. Took me less than half an hour to edge the beds along the perimeter of my lawn. I’ll probably buy another one for my mother as she’s an avid gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Dazarella

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for overgrown curb or sidewalk edges. Used this to get a nice edge then I use my echo edger to maintain the edge
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I have absolutely no complaints. And i would buy it again if I neeed too, but doubt I will ever need another. The quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffy2Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for manual work
customer_reviews.text: I have had an issue with edging my yard for the longest time. This tool was a huge help! I just did a little bit tonight and it looks 10 million times better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thick & Seems Durable
customer_reviews.text: Cool tool. Fun to use. Get a work out in yard. Easy to use for the feet. Can use to balance like a Pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: Panther

customer_reviews.title: Great tool when the soil is right
customer_reviews.text: good tool to use to edge your garden beds but if you are working in hard clay soil these tool will not work.
customer_reviews.author: nevia

customer_reviews.title: A great yard tool!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this edger!!! It is light, sturdy and so easy to use. It made an amazing straight edge. I landscaped my whole backyard with this tool. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Tool is not sharp enough to cut sod
customer_reviews.text: This tool is not sharp enough to cut sod, which is its intended purpose. Appears to be well made,- probably OK for maintaining an edge - but certainly not for creating one. One would assume that rocking the serrated teeth would help with cutting action, but it does not.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Completely ineffectual vs lippia
customer_reviews.text: This device is completely unable to cut through lippia (aka Phyla nodiflora). Unfortunately, that is the primary task that I purchased it for...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well edging a lawn that gas and electric powered edgers have a lot of difficulty doing. Results were very good. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to take a section out of my yard to plant a border along the sidewalk. Great tool for the job. I took about 17 to 18 inches by 15 feet for my planting bed.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Great efficient tool...much better than edging with a shovel!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and cuts thru though dirt with ease! Has teeth on the end that help cut thru tough sod. And it's a great price!
customer_reviews.author: K. Riegel

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small jobs. The teeth are very sharp and hold up very well. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: gives you good leverage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but does not give you as much surface as compared to a grading shovel. Great around curves.

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding a trench for edging!
customer_reviews.text: The serrated edge cuts through dirt and vines easily. Superior to pricier metal alternatives, and easier for my tiny arms to use!

customer_reviews.title: Does not do the job.
customer_reviews.text: This does not cut through grass. Would not purchase again or recommend this product.
